comment.author: 63413954@N00
comment._content: One sign reads "Ettor and Giovannitti must be released"

comment.author: 63276268@N00
comment._content: sobotka beat me to it! I was going to mention the sign as well. What a fascinating frozen moment in time. I wonder if this was a demonstration in support of the Lawrence Textile Strike or if this was afterwards when they (Ettor and Giovannetti) were still jailed. Must be sometime in 1912.

comment.author: 22359426@N04
comment._content:
May 1st, 1912 - the picture is dated at the top.  

5/1 is also a traditional day for socialist marches, even today.

comment.author: 49503002139@N01
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Socialism, and we'd love to have your photo added to the group.

comment.author: 24363024@N06
comment._content: If you look to the left of the E&G sign, you can make out another sign at a sharp angle that reads "One Big Union" which was the motto of the IWW in Canada as well as the US.
